content.raw:
When nonlinear time is enabled, and I move the mouse over any plot, I get the following error message:


```
#!python

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\labscript_suite\runviewer\__main__.py", line 323, in <lambda>
    time_axis_plot.scene().sigMouseMoved.connect(lambda pos: self.mouseMovedEvent(pos, time_axis_plot, "Slots"))
  File "C:\labscript_suite\runviewer\__main__.py", line 486, in mouseMovedEvent
    text = "Plot: {} \nTime: {:.9f}s\nValue: {}".format(name, unscaled_t, y_val)
ValueError: Unknown format code 'f' for object of type 'unicode'
```

I am running this on Python 2.7, with PyQt4 and have the tooltip-y-value pull request #24 merged in. I have tested that it also occurs when tooltip-y-value is not merged, and with PyQt5.

Note that this only occurs when time is nonlinear.
